subject: RE: [junit] Design documentation for JUnit 4.x?
msgSnippet: Dear Hans, It makes sense that you re frustrated at the lack of a design-level introduction to JUnit. When I encountered Eclipse for the first time I was so
messageBody:
Dear Hans,

It makes sense that you're frustrated at the lack of a design-level
introduction to JUnit. When I encountered Eclipse for the first time I was
so lost. I ended up writing the "Contributing to Eclipse" book out of that
experience. I don't know if this will be helpful, but you may be the
best-placed person on the planet to write the introduction you wish you had.
You have the motivation. You know what you want to learn about the software.
Those are two essential factors you have that I, for one, don't have. I've
found that the things I write out of such a situation have the most impact,
because I care the most.

Regards,

Kent Beck
Three Rivers Institute

_____

From: junit@yahoogroups.com [mailto:junit@yahoogroups.com] On Behalf Of Hans
Schwaebli
Sent: Friday, October 24, 2008 6:55 AM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: Re: [junit] Design documentation for JUnit 4.x?



Well, I tried that now. It is not the kind of documentation I meant.

Such tools just twist and twirl data and present it in a way which does not
help much to understand the design.

A good documentation cannot be automated away or roundtripped.

You need some text and some diagrams. Both need not be perfect. But as I
said, that can't be automated, or at least is not valuable for understanding
it quickly as it would be from a human who knows how man thinks and how the
design is and what does matter to know and what is unnecessary detail.

But it seems no matter what I would write, you mean that there will be no
such manual documentation. A little design documentation would be very good
for understanding such a widely used tool. Thousands of programmers should
not need to download a specific tool and then discover that it does not help
them understanding JUnit's design.

Just my opinion.

--- On Thu, 10/23/08, David Saff <david@... <mailto:david%40saff.net> >
wrote:
From: David Saff <david@... <mailto:david%40saff.net> >
Subject: Re: [junit] Design documentation for JUnit 4.x?
To: junit@yahoogroups. <mailto:junit%40yahoogroups.com> com
Date: Thursday, October 23, 2008, 1:45 PM

None published.

If someone wanted to download a trial copy of Structure 101 and

produce some, that'd be cool, and I'd be happy to answer questions.

David Saff
